title: >>> BACK on the MOUNTAIN
body_text:
Within the last two dodgeball events, there have been some dramatic changes. DODGEBALL XXIV and DODGEBALL XXV will go down in history as two of the most unrelated events, yet still showed the same dodgeball spirit and passion. DODGEBALL XXIV saw the supposed "slump" at its lowest. Is the "slump" over? ...
The facts tell the story ...
> "On the Flip Side ..." (Differences)
I.
DODGEBALL XXIV had 21 players [with at least 8 spectators]. The uproar hit when DODGEBALL XXV had an awesome 31 participants. The only events* that beat that number are XONE, XTWO, 13, 15, and 20. *DODGEBALL XIV and DODGEBALL XXV are tied
II.
For the first time in history, DODGEBALL XXIV had not one new player. DODGEBALL XXV however went extreme with new talent with an overwhelming 11 new players; the highest number of newblood since DODGEBALL DAY 2.
III.
XXIV saw dry weather while XXV was "Wet War IV", the second "Wet War" in 4 weeks.
> "On that Note ..." (Similarities)
I.
DODGEBALL XXIV saw the likes of Steve Adams and Dan Spengeman miss their very first event. DODGEBALL XXV continued that pattern when another veteran missed his first event; the legendary Tom Adams. Tom had participated in every single event since DODGEBALL 8; his dodgeball debut.
II.
Kevin Megill made his long awaited return at DODGEBALL XXIV, having not played since DAY 4. The biggest returns in terms of time were Valerie Winston and Ben Cotta, who were both inactive since "The ClimaXX", other wise known as  DODGEBALL 20.
> "Gore! Gore! Gore!" (Players)
New player Ray Marzarella had some impressive dodges and catches during the evening. He was the captain of his respective team and led them like a true competitor. Gerald Lewis, another new comer and rival captain, was also impressive mainly for his throwing ability, especially with the bigger "pain" balls.
Steve Adams came back after a one week hiatus and was a true asset on the court. He hit "rim" and eliminated numerous opponents by catching and throwing.
Although unrelated athletically, a few players this past week have been feeling less than 100%. Two players who were noticably sick during XXV, yet still showed a tremendous amount of heart [and maybe stupidity], were John Tronolone and Derek Carty. John has been battling bronchitis since the start of last week while Derek has been up against the flu.
Alison Bertsch, Lauren Freda, and Diana DiBuccio all caught well, proving that the ladies can and will knock down anyone in front of them.
> "SmackDown! vs. RAW" (The Match)
For the first time in dodgeball history, new comers were captains. Gerald Lewis and Ray Marzarella picked teams basically on clothing, look, and other physical attributes. This certainly gave XXV a more random set-up. Despite the "lottery-type" teams, the action itself could go down as some of the best ever.
Ray and his new found friends [and more so allies] were an instant threat to "G-Money" (according to Gerald's shirt). The first half of XXV belonged to the high-flying prodigy, with a score of 4 to 2. But the ever powerful Gerald Lewis was far from defeat ...
The night's counter-strike came late though, when Lewis and company did mount an offensive close to the end of XXV. Despite the sudden turnaround, the score still stood at a two point difference. DODGEBALL XXV, one of the most misleading events in history, ended with Ray taking home the gold 6 to 4. An outstanding match-up it was.
________________________________________
_____
> "The Pre-Show" (Diana's Dodgeball Dinner)
On the eve of DODGEBALL XXV, Diana DiBuccio threw an awesome "dodgeball" party for all past-players. Built as a "pasta party", the idea for the dinner was to get everyone "carbed" up for the following night. It was a success with excellent pasta dishes cooked by Diana's mother, Carol.
The activities during the night ranged. Dan Spengeman's documentary "Not JUST a Game" was publically viewed for the first time. It was a hit as immediate orders (for only $3) were available for purchase. It was a great way to start the night, perhaps making everyone realize that dodgeball has created many great friendships and memories. Later in the evening saw a football-like frisbee game. The weather was not as bad as it might have seemed, so numerous people went on to play outside.
Overall, the party was a success. It started at 7PM and went to about the 1AM mark.
________________________________________
_____
> "Did You Know?" (What to Expect)
I.
DODGEBALL 26 contest posters must be sent in by February 7th. The contest will take place immediately after.
II.
The idea of a daytime dodgeball event has been brought up nuermous times. If anyone would like to go ahead with this idea, a date shall be planned. Until then, all events start at 7PM.
III.
Schedule of events:
Saturday, 02/11/06 ~ DODGEBALL 26
Friday, 02/17/06 ~ DODGEBALL 27
Saturday, 02/25/06 ~ DODGEBALL 28
Saturday, 03/04/06 ~ DODGEBALL 29
IV.
DODGEBALL XXV was supposed to have a "surprise", thus bringing back "history". Dan Spengeman was no where to be found though, as he was apart of the history, or at least his DVD. The surprise was that someone was going to win a free copy of his DVD, despite numerous purchases at Diana's party.
________________________________________
_____
DODGEBALL 26
February 11th, 2006
Start time 7PM
